comments:
I guess this issue is a locale common on Linux. All of Command invoking from quick access will pop up error dialog
Platform: RHEL5, SLES10
Driver: M7
JVM :IBM JRE5 SR4

Steps to recreate
1- Ctrl + 3 to get the quick access
2- select "CheatSheet..." from Commands

Result
Error dialog pop up. Here is the error stack.

We should check our shell type
PW
I have no time left in RC1 to look at this, marking for RC2.

Paul, I could use your help on this one. I close the popup shell before calling HandlerService.executeCommand(), but apparently, on Linux/GTK this is not processed right away leading to a null handler for that command. Is there anything I can do to hide the fact that I opened another shell?

Created an attachment (id=68556)
QuickAssistDialog v01

Registering the Shell as a window (as opposed to a dialog) gives handlers access to the active workbench window and leaves all of the action sets (and their actions) active.

In this case, the popup being a dialog meant that the cheatsheet action set was not active.

PW
Shouldn't we be removing the shell from the service at some point?

(In reply to comment #6)
> Shouldn't we be removing the shell from the service at some point?

If you need the shell to "change" you can unregister it, but the service also adds a dispose listener and will clean itself up.  I think the QuickAssistDialog is fine always being a "window" shell until it goes away.

PW
We'd like to have bugs end up in VERIFIED state. Reopening.
